            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2>2. Your offer of admission</h2>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><b>Please read and review all of the information</b> in your Offer of Admission once you receive it. If you have any questions regarding the specifics, please contact the individual who signed your Offer of Admission. Should you need any clarification about the terms used on your Offer of Admission, you can refer to our Glossary of Terms.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4>Accepting your Offer of Admission:</h4>
<ol>
<li>Log in to the <a href="https://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia Portal</a></li>
<li>Go to the â€œApplication Centreâ€? and click on the â€œView Statusâ€? button</li>
<li>From the Program Selection/Status page you will be directed to â€œStart the confirmation processâ€?</li>
<li>Accept the Offer of Admission and pay the $100 (CAD) confirmation deposit</li>
</ol>
<p>The confirmation deposit is non-refundable but will be credited to your account and applied towards your tuition fees.</p>
<h3>Deadline for to confirm your Offer of Admission:</h3>
<p>Please confirm by the date indicated on your Offer of Admission. If you do not confirm by the specified date, your admission may be cancelled. If there is no confirmation date indicated, do not worry, not all programs require that students confirm their admission.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4>Questions About Your Offer of Admission</h4>
<h5>What Happens if I do Not Meet the Conditions of Admission?</h5>
<p>If you do not meet the conditions of your admission, you may no longer qualify to enter the program to which you were conditionally admitted. If there are extenuating circumstances that affected your ability to meet the conditions of your admission, you should send a letter of appeal as soon as possible to the individual who signed your Offer of Admission. This letter must include a detailed description of these circumstances, and supporting documentation. Common conditions to meet include maintaining a specific average or grade, successfully completing the final term or semester of study, satisfying academic admission requirements, or sending specific documents.</p>
<h5>What if I Have Questions About the Assessment of my Exemptions, Deficiencies and/or Transfer Credits?</h5>
<p>You can send a detailed written request for evaluation to the attention of the individual who signed your Offer of Admission. Appropriate supporting documentation (e.g. course outlines) must accompany your request if they have not already been provided. Please note that evaluations cannot be done on the spot, and may take time, and therefore should be requested as soon as possible.</p>
<h5>Can I Defer my Tuition to Another Term?</h5>
<p>Your admission is valid for only one term, unless otherwise indicated on your Offer of Admission, and cannot be deferred to another term. If you do not register for the term to which you were admitted, you must reapply. Documents sent in support of your original application will not need to be resubmitted.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4>Admission to Colleges and Co-operative Education</h4>
<h3>Institute for Co-operative Education</h3>
<p>If you have applied to participate in the co-operative education program, please consult the â€œImportant Admission Informationâ€? section of your Offer of Admission. If you have any questions you can contact the <a href="http://co-op.concordia.ca/">Institute for Co-operative Education</a> directly at 514-848-2424, ext. 3950 or by email at <a href="mailto:coopinstitute@concordia.ca">coopinstitute@concordia.ca</a>.</p>
<h3>Colleges, Institutes, Schools</h3>
<p>Concordia's <a href="http://artsandscience.concordia.ca/">Faculty of Arts and Science</a> is home to three colleges, one school and one institute. In general, if you have applied to the <a href="http://wsdb.concordia.ca/">Simone de Beauvoir Institute</a> or the <a href="http://loyc.concordia.ca/">Loyola College for Diversity and Sustainability</a> (LCDS), you will be automatically admitted upon your admission to Concordia. The <a href="http://liberalartscollege.concordia.ca/">Liberal Arts College</a>, <a href="http://scicol.concordia.ca/">Science College</a> and the <a href="http://scpa-eapc.concordia.ca/">School of Community and Public Affairs</a> will notify you once a decision has been made on your application.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation">

<ul style='display:block;'><li class='open'><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide.html'>Guide to First Year</a><div class='arrow '><i></i></div><ul style='display:block;'><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/1-portal.html'>1. MyConcordia Portal</a></li><li class='open'><a class='active' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/2-offer-of-admission.html'>2. Offer of Admission</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/3-transcripts.html'>3. Plan your finances</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/5-courses.html'>5. Select your courses</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/6-housing.html'>6. </div>

    });

</script></div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2>3. Send final transcripts</h2>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>If you have received conditional admission you must ensure that Concordia receives a copy of your official final transcripts indicating that you have earned your diploma and achieved the required grades, as well as any other required documents outlined in your Offer of Admission. Transcripts are only considered official if they are sent directly from your previous educational institution(s) to the Admissions Application Centre at Concordia. Faxed copies and notarized documents are not considered official.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4>How to send official documents</h4>
<h3>Sealed envelope method</h3>
<p>Applicants from within North America may use the â€œsealed envelopeâ€? method, whereby you request that each previous educational institution provide you with a copy of your official transcript, sealed in an envelope bearing the name and address of the school, the institutional logo (if applicable), a notice on the envelope stating that it contains official transcripts, and a signature/signature stamp/explanatory label placed across the seal of the envelope. If you enclose such an envelope, unopened, in a separately addressed envelope to the Admissions Application Centre, the transcript will be considered official.</p>
<h3>Quebec Cegep students</h3>
<p>If you have already provided Concordia with your permanent code on your application form, your official final transcripts will be sent to us automatically.</p>
<p>Unless notified otherwise, you are not required to arrange for submission of an official Cegep transcript.</p>
<h3>Ontario high school students</h3>
<p>If you have applied for the fall term and have provided Concordia with your current OUAC number on your application form, your final transcripts will be sent to us automatically. If you have applied for the winter term, you must arrange to have your school send an official final transcript indicating that the diploma has been awarded to the Admissions Application Centre before the beginning of the term.</p>
<h3>All Other Applicants</h3>
<p>Official final transcripts must be mailed directly from your previous school(s) to the Admissions Application Centre at Concordia. All transcripts should be in the original language. If that is neither English nor French, you must also submit a copy translated into English or French by a certified translator. If the transcript does not detail the subjects taken and the grades achieved, a certified statement of these from an authorized official of the institution must also be submitted.</p>
<h3>College/University Transfer Students</h3>
<p>You must arrange for the submission of an official final transcript showing the successful completion of courses in progress. In the case of students who are being awarded a degree, the transcript must indicate that the degree has been granted.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4>Official Documents Deadline</h4>
<p>Official transcripts and required documents must be received before the start of the term for which you were offered admission. If it appears that you will have difficulty meeting this deadline, please contact the individual who signed your Offer of Admission.</p>
<h4>Send official documents to:</h4>
<p>Concordia University<br>
Admissions Application Centre<br>
P.O. Box 2900<br>
Montreal, Quebec, Canada<br>
H3G 2S2</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4>How to Find Out if Your Documents Have Been Received</h4>
<p>You can verify that your official transcripts and other documents have been received through the â€œApplication Centreâ€? on the <a href="https://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia Portal</a>. Under â€œDocuments Receivedâ€? you will be able to view all documents relevant to the admission process that have been received over the last 18 months.</p>
<p>Please note that the time it takes for documents to arrive at Concordia varies depending on where they were sent from and by what method. Due to the high volume of documents received at certain times of the year, documents may not appear on the <a href="https://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia Portal</a> right away.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation">

<ul style='display:block;'><li class='open'><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide.html'>Guide to First Year</a><div class='arrow '><i></i></div><ul style='display:block;'><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/1-portal.html'>1. MyConcordia Portal</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/2-offer-of-admission.html'>2. Offer of Admission</a></li><li class='open'><a class='active' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/3-transcripts.html'>3. Final transcripts</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/4-finances.html'>4. Plan your finances</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/5-courses.html'>5. </div>

jQuery(function() {
    $ = jQuery;
    $("#secondary_navigation.c-secondary-navigation .arrow").click(function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        var $this = $(this);
        $this.toggleClass('open');
        $this.parent().children('ul').slideToggle('fast');
    });
});
</script></div>

        <p>Thanks for your time. Please select your area of feedback.</p>
        <ul>
            <li><a href="/web/feedback-forms/feedback-bad-link.html">I want to report a bad link</a></li>
            <li><a href="/web/feedback-forms/feedback-cant-find.html">I can't find something on the website</a></li>
            <li><a href="/web/feedback-forms/feedback-tell-us.html">I'd like to share my impressions of the site</a></li>
        </ul>
    </div>
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
$=jQuery;
$(function() {
    var check = mobilecheck();
    if (!check) {
        $("#feedback-modal").attr("href", "#modal");
        $('a[rel*=leanModal]').leanModal({top: 200, closeButton: ".modal-close"});
    }
});
</script>

    </div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2>4. Plan your finances</h2>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>The <b>Financial Aid and Awards Office</b> can help you explore and navigate the available resources and find funding opportunities through the following channels:</p>
<ul>
<li>University and privately funded scholarships and bursary programs</li>
<li>Government student loans and bursaries</li>
<li>Concordia student assistance programs (including tuition deferrals, emergency loans and food vouchers, and bookstore line of credit)</li>
<li>On-campus work opportunities</li>
</ul>
<p>For more information on student financial assistance visit the <a href="http://faao.concordia.ca/">Financial Aid and Awards Office</a>.</p>
<p>When it comes to planning the financing of your studies, the most important thing to remember is, don't wait!</p>
<h3>Applying for Government Student Loans and Bursaries</h3>
<p>If you plan on seeking provincial assistance to help finance your education, you should have already applied by the time you receive your Offer of Admission. If you havenâ€™t done so, apply as soon as possible!</p>
<p>Students who are Canadian citizens or permanent residents apply for government student loans from the province in which they reside. All supporting documents must be sent to the province in which you applied. Any requests for confirmation of student status, enrolment or program information forms should be forwarded to the Financial Aid and Awards Office (FAAO) to be processed. The deadlines to submit applications vary. Please check the appropriate provincial or territorial financial assistance website for deadlines. Provincial website links can be found on the FAAO website, <a href="http://faao.concordia.ca/">faao.concordia.ca</a>. International students must seek government assistance from their home country.</p>
<h3>Quebec Student Loans and Bursaries</h3>
<p>Quebec residents can apply for Quebec loans and bursaries online at afe.gouv.qc.ca/index.asp. Students are encouraged to submit their loan or bursary application as early as possible and at least six to eight weeks before beginning their studies.</p>
<h3>Scholarships and Bursaries</h3>
<p>Concordia offers two types of awards to first-time university students: Entrance Scholarships and Entrance Bursaries.</p>
<ul>
<li><b>Entrance Scholarships</b><br>
Entrance scholarships are awarded by each Faculty. The scholarships are awarded based on scholastic achievement and in some cases, non-academic criteria. There is no application necessary for the majority of scholarships. If you have been awarded a scholarship, there will be a notification on your Offer of Admission or you will be contacted by the Faculty.</li>
<br>
<li><b>Entrance Bursaries</b><br>
Undergraduate bursaries are awarded primarily on the basis of financial need and academic standing. Students can complete the Entrance Bursary application online through the MyConcordia Portal.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Other Scholarship Opportunities</h3>
<p>External awards include privately funded scholarships and bursaries sponsored and administered by external associations, companies, foundations, societies, and clubs. Applications must be submitted directly to these organizations and this information can be found on the <a href="http://faao.concordia.ca/">Financial Aid and Awards website</a>.</p>
<p>Visit the FAAO to receive in-depth assistance based on your personal situation, <a href="http://faao.concordia.ca/">faao.concordia.ca</a>.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation">

<ul style='display:block;'><li class='open'><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide.html'>Guide to First Year</a><div class='arrow '><i></i></div><ul style='display:block;'><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/1-portal.html'>1. MyConcordia Portal</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/2-offer-of-admission.html'>2. Offer of Admission</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/3-transcripts.html'>3. Final transcripts</a></li><li class='open'><a class='active' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/4-finances.html'>4. Plan your finances</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/5-courses.html'>5. Select your courses</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/6-housing.html'>6. Housing options</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/7-health-coverage.html'>7. Health coverage</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/8-tuition.html'>8. Pay your tuition fees</a></li></ul></li></ul>
</div>
<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery(function() {
    $ = jQuery;
    $("#secondary_navigation.c-secondary-navigation .arrow").click(function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        var $this = $(this);
        $this.toggleClass('open');
        $this.parent().children('ul').slideToggle('fast');
    });
});
</script></div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

    
    <div class="container">    
        





<div class="breadcrumb breadcrumbs">



<ul class="c-breadcrumb breadcrumb">

	        <li>
                <a href="/" onclick="CQ_Analytics.record({event:'followBreadcrumb',values: { breadcrumbPath: '/content/concordia/en' },collect: false,options: { obj: this },componentPath: 'concordia/components/breadcrumb'})">
                    Home
                </a>
	        </li>
	        &nbsp;&gt;&nbsp;
	        <li>

                </a>
	        </li>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>5. Select your courses</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>At Concordia you can create a schedule that fits your life and your goals. Some programs have greater flexibility than others, but no matter the program, just follow these three easy steps to create your class schedule:</p>
<ol>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="#1">Check your advising requirements</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="#2">Plan your class schedule</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="#3">Register for your courses online</a></li>
</ol>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4><a name="1"></a>1. Academic Advising</h4>
<p>Most programs require that newly admitted students receive academic advising or attend an orientation session before they can start their online registration. Details regarding advising can be found in the â€œImportant Admission Informationâ€? section of your Offer of Admission. It is important that you fulfill your advising requirements as soon as possible so that you can proceed with registering for your courses. In general, the advising guidelines for the four Faculties are as follows:</p>
<h3>John Molson School of Business</h3>
<p>New students must watch all five short new student advising videos, found on the JMSB website (<a href="http://johnmolson.concordia.ca/en/undergrad/1052-new-student-advising-videos">johnmolson.concordia.ca/en/undergrad/1052-new-student-advising-videos</a>) and follow the instructions on how to submit the online Permission to Register Form. Once the Permission to Register Form has been submitted you will be able to register within 72 hours.</p>
<h3>Faculty of Engineering and Computer Science</h3>
<p>Once you have been accepted, you should register as soon as possible through the MyConcordia Portal. Advising is not required; however, as outlined in your Offer of Admission, you are strongly encouraged to attend one of the Faculty of Engineering and Computer Science advising sessions. Students accepted into an ENCS program who have completed all required prerequisites will follow a sequence that will lead to graduation after four years (8 terms) of study. Please see <a href="http://encs.concordia.ca/sequences">encs.concordia.ca/sequences</a> for a summary of program-specific courses ENCS students must follow in their first year of study.</p>
<h3>Faculty of Fine Arts</h3>
<p>Advising and registration procedures vary by program. Please consult <a href="http://finearts.concordia.ca/advising">finearts.concordia.ca/advising</a> for specific information for your program. If your program does not require advising before registration, you should register for your courses as soon as possible, taking into consideration the first-year recommended courses listed in the advising information for your program.</p>
<h3>Faculty of Arts and Science</h3>
<p>Advising is mandatory for all programs in the Faculty of Arts and Science. Please consult <a href="http://fas.newstudentadvising.concordia.ca">fas.newstudentadvising.concordia.ca</a> in order to select an advising appointment convenient for you. Students who are unable to schedule an in-person advising appointment are encouraged to contact their department to make alternate arrangements. For additional Faculty-specific information refer to the Academic Advising Guide for students in the Faculty of Arts and Science: <a href="http://artsandscience.concordia.ca">artsandscience.concordia.ca</a>.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4><a name="2"></a>2. Plan Your Class Schedule</h4>
<p>After reviewing the information for new students that is relevant to your program and â€” if necessary â€” after having completed your advising requirements, you are now ready to plan your schedule and register for classes. The two key sources of information when planning your schedule are the online Undergraduate Calendar and the Undergraduate Class Schedule. You can access the Calendar and Class Schedule from the homepage of the MyConcordia Portal.</p>
<h3>The Undergraduate Calendar</h3>
<p>The online <a href="/academics/undergraduate/calendar.html" adhocenable="false">Undergraduate Calendar</a> specifies the courses you will need to complete in order to meet your degree requirements. The Calendar is easy to navigate allowing you to search and download sections by department and look up full course descriptions.</p>
<p>The basic guidelines are as follows:</p>
<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">
<tbody><tr><td width="20" valign="top"><img width="15" height="14" alt="White Dot" src="/content/dam/concordia/offices/registrar/images/registration/whitedot.jpg"></td>
<td valign="top">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="top">All spaces open for all students.</td>
</tr><tr><td width="20" valign="top"><img width="15" height="14" alt="Half Dot" src="/content/dam/concordia/offices/registrar/images/registration/halfdot.jpg"></td>
<td valign="top">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="top">Most spaces reserved for students whose programs require the course, or for students in the Faculty offering the course. The remaining spaces are open to other students.<br>
&nbsp;</td>
</tr><tr><td width="20" valign="top"><img width="15" height="14" alt="Black Dot" src="/content/dam/concordia/offices/registrar/images/registration/blackdot.jpg"><br>
</td>
<td valign="top">&nbsp;</td>
<td valign="top">All spaces reserved for students in the Faculty offering the course, or whose programs require the course.<br>
</td>
</tr></tbody></table>
<p>For a full diagram on how to read the course listings visit: <a href="/students/registration/reading-course-listings.html" adhocenable="false">How to Read the Course Listings</a>.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4><a name="3"></a>3. Register for Your Courses Online</h4>
<p>Registration is done online through the MyConcordia Portal. Make sure that you are able to access your Portal before your registration start date. To access the registration page on your MyConcordia Portal, choose the â€œRegistrationâ€? tab and then select â€œUndergraduate Registration.â€? You can return to your Portal at any time during the registration period to make changes to your schedule. For registration assistance, please contact the helpline for your Faculty.</p>
<h3>General Concordia Phone Number: 514-848-2424</h3>
<ul>
<li><b>Arts and Science</b><br>
<a href="mailto:artsnsci@alcor.concordia.ca">artsnsci@alcor.concordia.ca</a>, ext. 2104</li>
<li><b>John Molson School of Business</b><br>
<a href="mailto:webreghelp@jmsb.concordia.ca">webreghelp@jmsb.concordia.ca,</a> ext. 8712</li>
<li><b>Engineering and Computer Science</b><br>
<a href="mailto:webreghelp@encs.concordia.ca">webreghelp@encs.concordia.ca</a>, ext. 3055</li>
<li><b>Fine Arts</b><br>
<a href="mailto:osa@concordia.ca">osa@concordia.ca,</a> ext. 4612</li>
</ul>
<h3>Register for All Possible Sessions</h3>
<p>Your registration start date applies for both terms. As such, you must register for both your fall and winter classes at the same time. If you wait until January to register for winter courses, many classes will already be full, limiting the courses or time selections available to you. Need more help? Check out the online Registration Guide at <a href="http://registrar.concordia.ca/webguide/">registrar.concordia.ca/webguide/</a></p>
<h3>Registration Start Date</h3>
<p>The 2013-14 registration start date for newly admitted students is as follows:<br>
<b>Fall and Winter 2013-2014 - April 22</b></p>
<h3>Dropping Classes</h3>
<p>The only way to formally drop a course, is by doing so through the <a href="https://www.myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia Portal</a>. Emailing, verbally informing a Concordia representative, or failing to attend class are not sufficient ways to withdraw from a course. Please note that each semester has specific registration and withdrawal deadlines. For a complete list of all important term dates, see the online Undergraduate Calendar. registrar.concordia.ca/calendar/</p>
<ul>
<li><b>DNE DEADLINE:</b><br>
You can withdraw from a course with no academic penalty, and a full tuition refund, if you do so before the Did Not Enter (DNE) deadline. Any courses that you drop before the DNE deadline will not appear on your transcript nor will they affect your grade point average (GPA). This allows you to make changes to your schedule during the first few weeks of classes. For an official list of DNE dates, see the <a href="http://registrar.concordia.ca/calendar/">Undergraduate Calendar</a>.</li>
<br>
<li><b>DISC DEADLINE:</b><br>
Courses dropped after the DNE deadline but before the Discontinued (DISC) deadline will remain on your record with the notation of â€œDISCâ€?. There will be no academic penalty associated with discontinued courses (no fail grade), but you will be responsible for paying all tuition and fees associated with the course (including the winter-term fees for any full-year courses). After the DISC deadline, courses cannot be dropped. For an official list of DISC dates, see the <a href="http://registrar.concordia.ca/calendar/">Undergraduate Calendar</a>.</li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation">

<ul style='display:block;'><li class='open'><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide.html'>Guide to First Year</a><div class='arrow '><i></i></div><ul style='display:block;'><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/1-portal.html'>1. </div>

jQuery(function() {
    $ = jQuery;
    $("#secondary_navigation.c-secondary-navigation .arrow").click(function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        var $this = $(this);

        $this.parent().children('ul').slideToggle('fast');
    });
});
</script></div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<H1>6. Consider your housing options</H1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Moving to a new city is an exciting experience. Whether you decided to live on or off campus, there are many factors to consider. We encourage you to take some time to research your options to find out what will best suit your needs and lifestyle.</p>
<h4>Residence Life</h4>
<p>Living on campus is a great way to meet new friends. All of Concordiaâ€™s residences are lively places filled with students from around the globe, and Residence Life Assistants are trained students living on-site who know first-hand the excitement and challenges of being new at Concordia.</p>
<h3>Do You Qualify to Live in Residence?</h3>
<p>Residences are currently reserved for:</p>
<ul>
<li>First-year, full-time undergraduate students between the ages of 17-22</li>
<li>Applicants who live more than 50 kilometres outside of the greater Montreal area</li>
<li>Students who are attending university for the first time</li>
</ul>
<h3>Applying to Live in Residence</h3>
<p>The link to the Residence Application will be available at the beginning of March on the MyConcordia Portal to students who have been offered conditional or final admission. There is a $100 non-refundable application fee that must be paid by Visa, MasterCard or American Express to access the application form.</p>
<p>Applicants will be asked to provide personal information, and answer questions about lifestyle and habits, building and room selections, and roommate preferences (if applicable). Please take the time to consider your answers carefully so that we can help place you in the best situation for your living and academic needs.</p>
<h3>Which Residence is Right for You?</h3>
<p>There are three residence buildings at Concordia to choose from. Our Grey Nuns Residence is located on the Sir George Williams Campus, right in the heart of downtown Montreal. Both Hingston Hall and the Jesuit Residence are on the Loyola Campus in Montrealâ€™s west end. For more information on the different residences, including floor plans, furnishings, and rates, please visit the Residence Life website at <a href="http://residence.concordia.ca">residence.concordia.ca</a>.</p>
<p>If you are considering living in residence, there are some community living standards in place to ensure the safety and comfort of all students. We encourage you to take the time to review these policies before deciding to live on campus. For instance, if you love to cook or have dietary restrictions you might find living in residence restrictive as students do not have personal access to kitchens.</p>
<p>There are also policies regarding noise with enforced quiet hours to contribute to your academic success, and all residences maintain a smoke-free environment.</p>
<h3>Meal Plan</h3>
<p>If you decide to live in residence you will be required to purchase a Meal Plan. On-campus food services are operated by Chartwells. There are several different plans to choose from so please review the options, menus, operating hours, locations, and costs outlined on the Chartwells website. Also, if you have strict dietary restrictions and/or allergies we suggest that you contact Chartwells to find out what your options will be before deciding if living in residence is right for you, <a href="http://www.dineoncampus.ca/concordia/index.cfm" adhocenable="false">dineoncampus.ca/Concordia.ca</a>.</p>
<h3>Security</h3>
<p>Residence buildings are locked at all times and accessible only by access cards. There are building security rounds both day and night, as well as clearly defined and practised emergency plans. To find out more, visit <a href="http://residence.concordia.ca/residencepolicies/safetyinresidence">residence.concordia.ca/residencepolicies/safetyinresidence</a>.</p>
<h3>Questions About Residence?</h3>
<p>Please contact Residence Life at <a href="mailto:residenceinfo@concordia.ca">residenceinfo@concordia.ca</a> or visit <a href="http://residence.concordia.ca">residence.concordia.ca</a></p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4>Off-Campus Housing</h4>
<p>Deciding to move out on your own is a big step. The first thing you should do is check out the Concordia Student Union Off-Campus Housing and Job Bank (Hojo) website at <a href="http://hojo.csu.qc.ca">hojo.csu.qc.ca</a>. Hojo is a fantastic resource for finding off-campus housing, learning about your rights as a tenant in Montreal, and helpful tips on things like roommate conflict prevention, energy conservation, and local safety resources.</p>
<p>Montreal ranks within the top 10 student-friendly cities around the world, and is also one of the most affordable cities in Canada. You can live steps away from your classes in the bustling Quartier Concordia in the borough of Ville Marie, near the quieter Loyola Campus in the borough of Notre-Dame-de-GrÃ¢ce, or in any one of Montrealâ€™s other dynamic neighbourhoods, from the Plateau/Mile-End to Griffintown or St. Henri. Wherever you choose to live, youâ€™ll find great housing options and a safe environment. For more information on the hot spots to live, visit Hojo or check out Tourism Montrealâ€™s guide to neighbourhoods, <a href="http://tourisme-montreal.org/Discover-montreal/Neighbourhoods">tourisme-montreal.org/Discover-montreal/Neighbourhoods</a></p>
<h3>Navigating Montreal Rental Listings - Whatâ€™s a 3Â½?</h3>
<p>Ã€ Louer = For Rent</p>
<p>Montreal has a particular way of describing apartment size. Learning the lingo is the first step in finding your new home. Remember, although there are variations, the Â½ always refers to a bathroom, and each room is counted.</p>
<p>1 Â½: one room, one bathroom (studio)<br>
2 Â½: one double room, one bathroom<br>
3 Â½: one separate room, one bathroom<br>
4 Â½: two separate rooms, one bathroom<br>
5 Â½: three separate rooms, one bathroom</p>
<p>When looking at rent costs, donâ€™t forget to factor in additional living expenses. Utilities are rarely included, so you will need to budget for electricity, Internet, furniture, appliances (not all apartments in Montreal include a fridge and stove), dishes, pots and pans â€” and the food to go along with them!</p>
<p>Whether you decided to go through Hojo, or find off campus housing on your own, make sure you do your homework! There are a lot of resources out there. Ask questions, shop around, be safe, and have fun.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation">

jQuery(function() {
    $ = jQuery;
    $("#secondary_navigation.c-secondary-navigation .arrow").click(function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        var $this = $(this);
        $this.toggleClass('open');
        $this.parent().children('ul').slideToggle('fast');
    });
});
</script></div>

<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"><div class="parbase picker">






<div class="c-bloc-relatedlinks bloc">
            <h2 class="section-header">Related Links</h2>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

                </a>

                    7. Health coverage
                </a>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<H1>7. Review your health care coverage</H1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4>The Concordia Student Union (CSU) Health and Dental Plan</h4>
<p>All Quebec and out-of-province students <b>registered for more than three credits</b> are automatically enrolled in the CSU Health and Dental Plan. Depending on the plan, coverage can include medical, vision, dental, and travel insurance. Visit <a href="http://ihaveaplan.ca">ihaveaplan.ca</a> for full details.</p>
<h3>Health Care Information for Out-of-Province Students</h3>
<p>If you are a Canadian out-of-province student covered elsewhere, you will need to notify your provincial health authority that you are studying in Quebec in order to retain health coverage while studying at Concordia. Certain coverage restrictions apply depending on your province so please consult the Health Services website to find out more details: <a href="http://health.concordia.ca">health.concordia.ca</a>.</p>
<h3>Health Care Information for International Students</h3>
<p>Immigration Quebec regulations require that all International students be covered by a health insurance plan that meets government standards while living in Quebec. In keeping with government directives, Concordia has adopted a compulsory health insurance plan for all Concordia International students. The Concordia University Health Insurance Plan for International Students is a comprehensive health and accident insurance plan at a competitive cost. For detailed information, visit the International Students Office website, <a href="http://supportservices.concordia.ca/iso/healthinsurance">supportservices.concordia.ca/iso/healthinsurance</a>.</p>
<h3>Opting Out</h3>
<p>If you are covered under another private health care plan (such as your parentâ€™s plan) check with your provider to ensure that you are covered even if you study out of province. You can change your coverage or opt out of the CSU health plan online (during the change-of-coverage period) at <a href="http://ihaveaplan.ca">ihaveaplan.ca</a>.</p>
<h3>Health Services</h3>
<p>Located on both campuses and exclusive to students, staff and faculty, Concordia Health Services provides high-quality health care and health promotion. In addition to its clinical services, Health Services also provides consultations with nurses, nutrition education and has a lending library with a variety of health information material. To visit a health care professional at Health Services, you will need to bring your Concordia student ID card as well as a health care card. Visit <a href="http://health.concordia.ca">health.concordia.ca</a> for locations, hours and a complete list of services.</p>
<h3>Counselling and Psychological Services</h3>
<p>Counselling and Psychological Services connects students with professional counsellors, accredited psychotherapists and psychologists to assist in clarifying and managing personal difficulties. Services are free for registered students and are completely confidential. Counselling and Psychological Services offers many workshops, groups and online resources to provide information and support on a variety of topics. For more information <a adhocenable="false" href="http://counselling.concordia.ca">visit counselling.concordia.ca.</a></p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>8. Pay your tuition fees</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table   horizontalLines verticalLines table-striped">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><td style="text-align: center;">It is important to pay your tuition and fees on time<br>
to avoid any late-payment fees.</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4>How to Pay Your Tuition and Fees</h4>
<h5>&nbsp;By Interac</h5>
<p>The easiest and most convenient way to pay tuition fees is by Interac via the MyConcordia Portal. Please note:&nbsp; &nbsp;</p>
<ul>
<li>This option is <b>only </b>for students with a debit/bank card with <b>Scotiabank, Bank of Montreal, Royal Bank, </b>or <b>TD Canada Trust</b></li>
<li>Interac payments made online through the Portal will <b>appear instantly</b> on your student account<br>
</li>
<li>Once you log in to MyConcordia, you can find the <b>online payment form</b> under the menu item â€œStudent Account Services.&quot;</li>
</ul>
<h5><br>
Telephone, online banking systems, ATM<br>
</h5>
<p>Tuition fees can also be paid via your bankâ€™s telephone or online banking services, or by an automated teller machine (ATM). To pay by these methods you must:</p>
<ul>
<li>Set up Concordia University as a bill payee with a Canadian chartered bank<br>
</li>
<li>Use your seven-digit student ID number as the Concordia account number.<br>
</li>
<li>There is a minimum processing time of three to five business days for the payment to appear on your student account.</li>
</ul>
<h5><br>
Other methods of payment</h5>
<ul>
<li>Please refer to the Tuition and Fees website (<a href="/admissions/tuition-fees/how-fees-are-billed/undergraduate/obligations.html" adhocenable="false">concordia.ca/admissions/tuition-and-fees/undergraduate/regulations/obligations</a>) for a complete list of Methods of Payment.</li>
<li>In-person payments can be made at the <a href="/students/birks.html" adhocenable="false">Birks Student Service Centre</a> (<a href="/maps/buildings/lb.html" adhocenable="false">LB 185</a>) by personal or certified cheque, money order, bank draft or debit card (Interac). Cash and credit cards are not accepted as forms of tuition payment.</li>
</ul>
<p>More details about tuition and fees can be found online at <a href="/admissions/tuition-fees.html" adhocenable="false">concordia.ca/admissions/tuition-and-fees</a>.</p>
<h4>Picking up your student loan</h4>
<p>Student financial aid is disbursed at the Financial Aid and Awards Office. However, there are some exceptions so please check the MyConcordia Portal for the exact location of where to pick up your loan or bursary. To find out if your loan or bursary is ready to be picked up, log in to the MyConcordia Portal and access the â€œFinancialâ€? tab on the left of your screen. Next, click on â€œFinancial Aid and Awards,â€? then â€œLoan and Bursary.â€? If you are expecting a payment and there is none available, please call Financial Aid and Awards at 514-848-2424, ext. 3507.</p>
<h4>Loan disbursement requirements</h4>
<h5><b>For all provinces except Quebec</b></h5>
<p>In order to pick up your loan and have it signed, you must present two forms of valid, government- issued identification. It is important that the combination of these two pieces of identification include your photo, your name, your address and your Social Insurance Number.</p>
<h4>International fee exemptions</h4>
<p>The Quebec Ministry of Higher Education, Research, Science and Technology has established a number of fee exemptions for International students, which allow them to pay the Quebec tuition rate rather than the International tuition rate. Some of the exemption categories are: Diplomats and their dependents, refugees and French citizens. Please consult the following site for complete details: <a href="http://registrar.concordia.ca/InternationalFee">registrar.concordia.ca/InternationalFee</a>.</p>
<h4>French program fee exemptions</h4>
<p>Full-time undergraduate out-of-province Canadian citizens or permanent residents studying French Language or Literature or taking individual French courses may be exempt from the differential fees for some French courses. International students may be exempted from differential fees for approved French courses if they are taken within a bachelorâ€™s, masterâ€™s or PhD program. For further information, please consult the website: <a href="http://frenchprogramexemption.concordia.ca">frenchprogramexemption.concordia.ca</a>.</p>
<h4>Quebec residency and Quebec residency fees</h4>
<p>Anyone who is not a Quebec resident pays an additional differential fee per credit. This fee is collected by Quebec universities on behalf of the Ministry of Higher Education.</p>
<h4>If I am a Quebec resident, how do I prove it?</h4>
<p>There are 14 different scenarios outlined by the Quebec Ministry of Higher Education that will grant you Quebec residency. All students, including those who have previously studied at a Quebec Cegep, should verify that their Quebec residency has been established at Concordia. Check your residency status before the fee payment deadline by logging onto the MyConcordia Portal and verifying that the fees being charged to your student account are correct. For further information on Quebec residency, please consult the website: <a href="http://quebecresidency.concordia.ca">quebecresidency.concordia.ca</a>.</p>
<p>If you are a Canadian citizen or permanent resident and qualify under the Quebec Ministry of Higher Education's criteria you can apply for Quebec resident status and upload supporting documents by logging onto the <a href="http://www.myconcordia.ca/" adhocenable="false">MyConcordia Portal</a>, selecting â€œStudent Servicesâ€? and â€œQuebec Residency Application.â€?</p>
<h4>â€œPermanent Codeâ€? Surcharge</h4>
<p>Everyone studying within Quebec must obtain an additional identification number called a â€œpermanent codeâ€? from the Quebec Ministry of Higher Education. If you do not have one already, obtaining your permanent code is easy and free. Submit a permanent code data form through the MyConcordia Portal, and upload your supporting documents (birth certificate, record of landing, or student authorization). If you do not receive a permanent code, you will be charged an additional surcharge per credit. For more information about the permanent code, visit <a href="http://permanentcode.concordia.ca">permanentcode.concordia.ca</a>.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table   horizontalLines verticalLines table-striped">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><td style="text-align: center;"><b></b>Deadline to apply for your permanent code and have the surcharge removed:<br>
Fall Admission â€“ December 15<br>
Winter Admission â€“ April 15</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">

<script type="text/javascript">
jQuery(function() {
    $ = jQuery;
    $("#secondary_navigation.c-secondary-navigation .arrow").click(function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        var $this = $(this);
        $this.toggleClass('open');
        $this.parent().children('ul').slideToggle('fast');
    });
});
</script></div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2>Frosh</h2>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase image section">




<div class="" id="cq-image-jsp-/content/concordia/en/students/new/orientation-frosh/jcr:content/content-main/image"><img title="tastesofConcordia" alt="tastesofConcordia" class="cq-dd-image" src="/students/new/orientation-frosh/_jcr_content/content-main/image.img.jpg/1375095648842.jpg"></div>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h4>Frosh events</h4>
<p>Each of the four faculties holds their own Frosh events at the start of the Fall term. <i>Frosh</i>, a word typically used for a freshly admitted first-year student, is also used to describe a series of activities. At Concordia, Frosh is a great way to meet other students and make friends before getting into the swing of the school year. Some of the events may have small signup fees, which are always affordable for the student on a budget.</p>
<h3>Frosh for all students</h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://csu.qc.ca/" target="_blank" adhocenable="false">Concordia Student Union (CSU) events for ALL undergraduate students<br>
 <br>
</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Frosh by faculty</h3>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://www.asfa.ca/" target="_blank" adhocenable="false">Arts &amp; Science Federation of Student Associations (ASFA)</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.casajmsb.ca/" target="_blank" adhocenable="false">CASA-JMSB (Commerce &amp; Administration Students' Association)</a></li>
<li><a href="http://www.ecaconcordia.ca/" target="_blank" adhocenable="false">Engineering &amp; Computer Science Association (ECA)</a></li>
<li><a adhocenable="false" href="http://www.fasaconcordia.com/" target="_blank">Fine Arts Student Alliance (FASA)</a></li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation">

<ul style='display:block;'><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide.html'>Guide to First Year</a><div class='arrow '><i></i></div><ul style='display:none;'><li class=''><a class='' href='/students/new/first-year-guide/1-portal.html'>1. jQuery(function() {
    $ = jQuery;
    $("#secondary_navigation.c-secondary-navigation .arrow").click(function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        var $this = $(this);
        $this.toggleClass('open');
        $this.parent().children('ul').slideToggle('fast');
    });
});

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

    
    <div class="container">

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2>Quick tips for new and returning students</h2>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parsys_column row-fluid cq-colctrl-lt0"><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt0-c0 span6"><div class="parbase image section">




<div class="" id="cq-image-jsp-/content/concordia/en/students/new/quick-tips/jcr:content/content-main/image"><img title="quicktips" alt="quicktips" class="cq-dd-image" src="/students/new/quick-tips/_jcr_content/content-main/image.img.jpg/1375888621981.jpg"></div>
</div>
</div><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt0-c1 span6"><div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<ul>
<li>Looking to get your Student Identification card?</li>
<li>Wondering about wireless access and obtaining your class books?</li>
<li>Be sure to read through these helpful tips and information for new students!</li>
</ul>

</div></div>
</div></div><div style="clear:both"></div><div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<h3><br>
Getting From One Campus to the Other</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">Travelling between our two campuses is fast and easy with the free Concordia shuttle bus. The shuttle bus takes students directly from one campus to the other in approximately 20 minutes. Consult the shuttle bus schedule page for regularly updated bus times and information. Click here to view the campus maps online.</p>
<h3>Birks Student Service Centre</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">The <a href="/students/birks.html" adhocenable="false">Birks Student Services Centre</a> is located in room <a adhocenable="false" href="/maps/buildings/lb.html">LB-185</a>&nbsp;of the J. W. McConnell Building. At Birks, you can obtain official documents for a variety of academic purposes. They offer a number of services, including tuition and fee payments, issuing of Concordia Student ID cards, official transcript requests, Quebec Provincial Residency and Permanent Code information, as well as the processing of paperwork for exam deferrals, degree transfers, re-admission, late completions, re-evaluations and appeals.</p>
<h3>F.A.S.T. Services</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">To help you move quickly through your student services needs during the first few weeks of the term you can also visit the Front-line Administrative Services Team (F.A.S.T.) set up within Birks, as well as in the atrium of the LB building. At the F.A.S.T. kiosks you are able to create your student ID card, obtain general student account information, as well as receive assistance accessing the wireless network on your laptop or mobile device. Visit F.A.S.T. for more information.</p>
<h3>Concordia Student ID card</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">Your Concordia student ID card is your school identification. You will need an ID card to borrow materials from the libraries, to take the shuttle bus from one campus to the other, and to prove your identity at final exams. Obtain your Concordia student ID card at the&nbsp;<a href="/students/birks.html">Birks Student Services Centre</a>&nbsp;or from a F.A.S.T. kiosk in the atrium of the LB building.</p>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">In order to have an ID card made, you will need to bring:</p>
<ol style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">
<li>A piece of photo identification (such as a provincial driverâ€™s license or passport)<b> </b></li>
<li>Your Offer of Admission or a class schedule</li>
</ol>
<h3 style="margin-top: 25px;">Student Bus Pass</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;"><i>How to get your OPUS card:</i><br>
The SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al (STM) offers a reduced-fare monthly bus/metro pass. Here is how to get your OPUS card:</p>
<ol style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">
<li>Visit the <a href="http://myconcordia.ca/">MyConcordia portal</a></li>
<li>Click on â€œ<b>Attestation Letters</b>â€? in the left-hand menu.</li>
<li>Print the letter and bring it to an OPUS on-campus Photo ID session (scheduled at Concordia for Sept. 30 and Oct. 1) or to the&nbsp;<a href="http://www.stm.info/info/centresac.htm#StudioPhoto">STM photo studio at Berri-UQÃ€M mÃ©tro station</a>.<br>
You will need proof of age and $14 in cash to cover the cost of the card.</li>
</ol>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">For more information on where to have your OPUS card made or to verify on-campus Photo ID session dates, as well as fees and travel fare details, please consult the <a href="http://www.stm.info/en/info/fares/opus-cards-and-other-fare-media/registered-photo-id-opus-card" adhocenable="false">STM website</a>.</p>
<h3>Agenda</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">Every year the Concordia Student Union (CSU) provides students with a free agenda. You can pick yours up from the CSU office on the seventh floor of the Hall building (H-711) during the first few weeks of classes. For a complete list of all the important term dates to enter in your agenda, see <a href="/events/academic-dates.html" adhocenable="false">Academic Calendar Dates</a>.</p>
<h3>Wireless Access</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">You can access wireless internet from your laptop or mobile device around both campuses; simply log onto the Concordia University network using your Concordia Netname and password. If you need assistance logging onto the network, contact the staff at <a href="http://iits.concordia.ca/">Instructional and Information Technology Services (IITS)</a><b></b></p>
<h3>Required Booklist</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">Near the beginning of the semester your professors will start to make the lists of required textbooks available online. You can find out what books you will need two ways; by accessing the Booklist on the MyConcordia Portal (under the â€œAcademicâ€? tab) or by going to the <a href="http://web2.concordia.ca/Bookstore/textbooks.booklist.shtml">Concordia University Bookstores website</a> and simply keying in your student ID number.</p>
<h3>Concordia University Bookstores</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">Concordia has two bookstores, one on each campus. The SGW bookstore is located on the main floor of the J.W. McConnell (LB) building, and the Loyola bookstore is located in the Communication Studies and Journalism (CJ) building. Along with your textbooks and coursepacks, the bookstores carry binders, notebooks, pens and pencils, so there is no need to run across town to get the basics. As a proud new Concordian, you can also grab some Concordia gear: t-shirts, sweatshirts, hoodies and bobbleheads â€“ just to name a few.</p>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">Visit the bookstore <a href="http://web2.concordia.ca/Bookstore/">website</a> for more information.</p>
<h3>Course Reserves</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">The <a href="http://library.concordia.ca/">Concordia University Libraries</a> keep course materials on reserve so that students can access textbooks, class notes and multimedia resources throughout the term. Course reserves have shorter loan times, but can be a great alternative to investing in some materials.</p>
<h3>Concordia Computer Store</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">Students can purchase a wide array of hardware and software at our two Computer Store locations. If youâ€™re looking for a new computer, portable media player or printer, the Computer Store is sure to have something for you. The Computer Storeâ€™s trained technicians are available to assist you with all your high-tech questions. For locations, store hours and more information on products and services visit the <a href="http://ccs.concordia.ca">Computer Store website</a>.</p>
<h3>Engineering and Computer Science Calculators</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">For those of you studying in the Faculty of Engineering and Computer Science, you must have one of the department-specified calculator models to be used during the exam period.</p>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">The approved models are the Sharp EL-531 W and the Casio FX-300MS. Any calculator other than these models will not be accepted. In order to prove that your calculator is an officially accepted model you will need to receive an approval sticker from the ENCS department (EV 2.189).</p>
<h3>Class Location</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">The MyConcordia portal has your class schedule and locations. Log onto MyConcordia portal to select â€œAcademicâ€? and then â€œMy Class Schedule.â€? You can also find out at the Information Desk in the Hall Building lobby, or by phoning 514-848-2424 ext. 8767.</p>
<h3>Obtaining a Locker</h3>
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">Students can sign up for lockers as of the first day of classes. Please log onto the MyConcordia portal, then select &quot;Other services&quot; then &quot;Get a Locker&quot;.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Telephone Services</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Voice Services manages a range of telephony-related operations. These include the universityâ€™s Cisco telephone and Unity voice mailbox systems, directory services, conference and long-distance calling, user accounts and general support.</p>
<h2>Requests for services or repairs</h2>
<p>Please contact the IITS Service Desk directly at <a adhocenable="false" href="mailto:help@concordia.ca">help@concordia.ca</a> or 514-848-2424, ext. 7613.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase section reference"><div style="display:inline;" class="cq-dd-paragraph"><div class="parbase box box_5">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<H1>Frontline administrative service team </H1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2>Rapid service with the F.A.S.T. team</h2>
</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>The beginning of the semester is always an exciting and busy time for new and returning Concordia students. You may have such questions as: Where can I get information? How do I access the MyConcordia Portal? Where can I obtain my student ID card?</p>
<p>Several services will be offered at various times on weekdays from <b>Monday, January 6, 2014 to Friday, January 31, 2014.</b> We encourage you to take advantage of these services to help you through this busy period.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2 class="section-header ">Our services</h2>
</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>We want your experience at Concordia to be successful â€“ take advantage of these services and get a strong start to the semester. If you have any questions about our services, please call 514-848-2424 extension 2668. We look forward to seeing you on campus!</p>

</div></div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item open">
        <a name="general-service-points"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open General service points">
					
                    General service points
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_1" style="display: block;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Additional Service Assistants at the general service points will be available to:</p>
<ul>
<li>Respond to inquiries about<ul>
<li><a href="/admissions/tuition-fees.html" adhocenable="false">Tuition and fees</a></li>
<li>Account restrictions (registration blocks)</li>
<li>Permanent code surcharges</li>
<li>payment and withdrawal deadlines</li>
<li>late payment and interest fees</li>
<li>payment arrangements</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Accept and <a href="/admissions/tuition-fees/fee-payment-deadlines/methods-of-payment.html" adhocenable="false">process payments</a> made by personal cheque, certified cheque, money order and debit (Interac) card;</li>
<li>Accept and verify <a href="/admissions/tuition-fees/permanent-code.html" adhocenable="false">Permanent Code</a> documents; and remove a Permanent Code surcharge from your student account if the documents are in order;</li>
<li>Accept and verify proof of <a href="/admissions/tuition-fees/quebec-residency.html" adhocenable="false">Quebec Residency Code</a> documents for students who were born in Quebec; and change tuition fee assessment to Quebec Residency rate;</li>
<li>Negotiate payment arrangements for students with an outstanding balance from a previous term in order to remove an accounts restriction.</li>
</ul>
<p><b>Where:</b><br>
<a href="/offices/birks.html" adhocenable="false">Birks Student Service Centre</a>, S-LB-185.</p>
<p><b>When:</b><br>
Services at the general service points will be available from</p>
<ul>
<li><b>January 6 to 10</b><ul>
<li>9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. Monday - Thursday</li>
<li>9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Friday</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><b>January 27 to 31</b><ul>
<li>9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. Monday - Thursday</li>
<li>9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Friday</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        <a name="student-id-card-service-points"></a>
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Student I.D. card service points">
					
                    Student I.D. card service points
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel_0" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Undergraduate and Graduate students will be able to obtain their Concordia student I.D. card* at the student I.D. card service points.</p>
<p><b>Where:<br>
 </b>Student I.D. card service points will be located in the back of the <a href="https://maps.google.com/maps?q=pavillion+jw+mcconnell&amp;hl=en&amp;sll=45.497156,-73.578081&amp;sspn=0.001607,0.004128&amp;hnear=Pavillion+J.W.+McConnell+Bldg,+Montreal,+Quebec+H3G+2V8,+Canada&amp;t=m&amp;z=17&amp;iwloc=A" adhocenable="false" target="_blank">McConnell Building Atrium</a> (near Tim Hortonâ€™s).</p>
<p><b>When:<br>
 </b>The student I.D. card service points will be available weekdays from 9:30 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. from&nbsp;Monday, January 6, 2014 to Friday, January 17, 2014.</p>
<p><b><i>*Please note:</i></b><i> You must bring one piece of photo ID as well as your student ID number. Student cards can only be produced once you have registered for courses (48 hours prior.)</i></p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase target section">








<div class="mboxDefault" id="content-concordia-en-students-fast-sidebar-picker">
    
</div>


<script type="text/javascript">
	var mboxId = 'content-concordia-en-students-fast-sidebar-picker';
	var mboxName = 'content-concordia-en-students-fast-sidebar-picker';
	var mboxLocation = '/content/concordia/en/students/fast/jcr:content/sidebar/picker';
	var wcmMode = 'DISABLED';

	if ( typeof mboxDefine == 'function' && wcmMode !== 'ANALYTICS' ) {
		var callParameters = [ mboxId ];
		var callFunction;
		var replaced = false;
	
		
				callFunction = mboxCreate;
		
		
		
		var staticParameters = {};
		
		for ( var key in staticParameters )
			callParameters.push(key  + '=' + staticParameters[key]);
		
		if ( !replaced ) { // do not define the same mbox twice, this leads to additional JS calls
			callFunction.apply(undefined, callParameters);
		}
		
		
		
		if ( callFunction == mboxDefine ) {
		    
		    // if the campaign store is available at this time we are most likely simulating
		    // so trigger an update if the (auto) campaign is selected
            var campaignStore = ClientContext.get("campaign");
            if ( campaignStore && !campaignStore.isCampaignSelected() ) {
                CQ_Analytics.TestTarget.triggerUpdate();
            }
    		
    		// wait for 2 seconds for the T&T answer to come in to prevent page flicker issues
    		// also see the overlay of mbox.protoype.setOffer which completes this
    		setTimeout(function() {
    		    CQ_Analytics.TestTarget.showDefaultMboxContent(mboxId, mboxName);
    		}, 2000);
		}
	}
	
	
		
</script>
</div>

					            <a tabindex="-1" href="/students/academic-resources/graduation-redirect.html">Graduation</a>
				            </li>

				            </li>
                    </ul> 
	            </li>

            	
            	<li class="dropdown ">
					
                    <a href="/students/financial-support.html" role="button" class="dropdown-toggle" data-toggle="">Financial matters</a>
                    <ul class="dropdown-menu">
                    		<li class="">

	            </li>
        </ul>
	</div>
</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>
