            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Office of the VP, Development &amp; External Relations, &amp; Secretary General</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>The office of the Vice-President, Development and External Relations and Secretary General is responsible for the fundraising activities and alumni stewardship of the University. The office also oversees the universityâ€™s policies, government and external relations, legal affairs and governance as well as institutional records management and archives, translation services, complaints process and standards of conduct.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parsys_column row-fluid cq-colctrl-lt0"><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt0-c0 span6"><div class="parbase button section">








<a style="margin-bottom:10px;" class="btn btn-large btn-block bg-light-grey" href="http://portico.concordia.ca/www/redesign/vpirsg/" target="_self">Learn more about the Office</a>

</div>
</div><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt0-c1 span6"><div class="parbase button section">








<a style="margin-bottom:10px;" class="btn btn-large btn-block bg-light-grey" href="/content/dam/concordia/offices/vpdersg/docs/concordia-vpirsg-organigram.pdf" target="_blank">View org chart</a>

</div>
</div></div><div style="clear:both"></div><div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="title section">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h2 class="section-header ">List of key people and units</h2>
</div></div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p><b>Vice-President, Development and External Relations and Secretary General:</b> <a adhocenable="false" href="/about/administration-governance/office-vp-development-external-relations-secretary-general/bram-freedman.html">Bram Freedman</a><br>
</p>
<p><b>Director</b>: &nbsp;Enza De Cubellis</p>
<p><b>Executive Assistant to the Vice-President</b>: Linda Hubert &nbsp;</p>
<p><a target="_blank" href="/content/dam/concordia/offices/vpdersg/docs/concordia-vpirsg-organigram.pdf" adhocenable="false">View org chart</a></p>

</div></div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Office of the VP, Development and External Relations and Secretary General directory">
					
                    Office of the VP, Development and External Relations and Secretary General directory
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>
        <div class="content row-fluid accordion_accordion_panel" style="display: none;">
            <div class="span12">
                <div class="parsys">


<div class="parbase table section">




<div class="concordia-table   horizontalLines">
    <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><td width="35%"><p><b><a adhocenable="false" href="/directories.html?f=search&amp;s1=16&amp;s2=17&amp;s3=8&amp;fname=bram&amp;lname=freedman">Bram Freedman</a></b></p>
</td>
<td><p>Vice-President, Development and External Relations and Secretary General</p>
</td>
</tr><tr><td width="35%"><p><b><a adhocenable="false" href="/directories.html?f=search&amp;s1=16&amp;s2=17&amp;s3=8&amp;fname=Enza&amp;lname=De+Cubellis">Enza De Cubellis</a></b></p>
</td>
<td><p>Director, Development and External Relations and Secretary General</p>
</td>
</tr><tr><td width="35%"><p><b><a adhocenable="false" href="/directories.html?f=search&amp;s1=16&amp;s2=17&amp;s3=8&amp;fname=Marie-Pierre&amp;lname=+Aub%C3%A9">Marie-Pierre AubÃ©</a></b></p>
</td>
<td><p>Director, Records Management and University Archives</p>
</td>
</tr><tr><td width="35%"><p><b><a adhocenable="false" href="/directories.html?f=search&amp;s1=16&amp;s2=17&amp;s3=8&amp;fname=Frederica+&amp;lname=jacobs">Frederica Jacobs</a></b></p>
</td>
<td><p>General Counsel</p>
</td>
</tr><tr><td width="35%"><p><b><a adhocenable="false" href="/directories.html?f=search&amp;s1=16&amp;s2=17&amp;s3=8&amp;fname=Dominique+&amp;lname=McCaughey">Dominique McCaughey</a></b></p>
</td>
<td><p>Associate Vice-President, Advancement and Alumni Relations</p>
</td>
</tr><tr><td width="35%"><p><b><a href="http://www.concordia.ca/content/concordia/en/directories.html?f=search&amp;s1=16&amp;s2=17&amp;s3=8&amp;fname=Gilbert&amp;lname=Tordjman&amp;ptitle=&amp;phone=&amp;email=&amp;departm=&amp;building=&amp;start=0" adhocenable="false">Gilbert Tordjman</a></b></p>
</td>
<td><p>Executive Director, Advancement and Alumni Services</p>
</td>
</tr><tr><td width="35%"><p><b><a href="/directories.html?f=search&amp;s1=16&amp;s2=17&amp;s3=8&amp;fname=Kristen+&amp;lname=Robillard">Kristen Robillard</a></b></p>
</td>
<td><p>Ombudsperson</p>
</td>
</tr><tr><td width="35%"><p><b><a href="/directories.html?f=search&amp;s1=16&amp;s2=17&amp;s3=8&amp;fname=louise&amp;lname=shiller">Louise Shiller</a></b></p>
</td>
<td><p>Director and Senior Advisor, Rights and Responsibilities</p>
</td>
</tr><tr><td width="35%"><p><b><a href="/directories.html?f=search&amp;s1=16&amp;s2=17&amp;s3=8&amp;fname=Danielle+&amp;lname=Tessier">Danielle Tessier</a></b></p>
</td>
<td><p>Director, Board and Senate Administration</p>
</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>The Office of the VP, Development and External Relations and Secretary General is comprised of the following administrative units.</p>
<h3>Advancement and Alumni Relations</h3>
<p><b>Associate Vice-President, Advancement and Alumni Relations</b>: Dominique McCaughey</p>
<p>Learn more about <a adhocenable="false" href="/alumni-friends.html">Advancement and Alumni Relations</a>.</p>
<hr>

<h3>Board and Senate Administration</h3>
<p>Ensures the proper operation of the Universityâ€™s Board of Governors, the Senate and standing committees. The unit also acts as a liaison between Board members and the university community.</p>
<p><b>Director, Board and Senate Administration</b>: Danielle Tessier</p>
<p>Learn more about the <a href="http://portico.concordia.ca/www/redesign/vpirsg/board-and-senate/" adhocenable="false">Board and Senate Administration</a>.</p>
<hr>

<h3>External Relations</h3>
<p>Acts as the liaison between the university and all levels of government and other external groups that include foundations, corporations and non-profit organizations.</p>
<p>Learn more about <a href="http://portico.concordia.ca/www/redesign/vpirsg/external-relations/" adhocenable="false">External Relations</a>.</p>
<hr>

<h3>Office of the General Counsel</h3>
<p>Provides practical, efficient and strategic legal advice and service to the University.</p>
<p><b>General Counsel</b>: Me Frederica Jacobs</p>
<p>Learn more about the <a href="http://portico.concordia.ca/www/redesign/vpirsg/office-of-the-general-counsel/" adhocenable="false">Office of the General Counsel</a>.</p>
<hr>

<h3>Office of Rights and Responsibilities</h3>
<p>Promotes and administers Universityâ€™s code of conduct.</p>
<p><b>Director and Senior Advisor, Rights and Responsibilities</b>: Louise Shiller</p>
<p>Learn more about the <a href="/students/rights.html" adhocenable="false">Office of Rights and Responsibilities</a>.</p>
<hr>

<h3>Ombuds Office</h3>
<p>Independently and impartially deals with problems and complaints within the University.</p>
<p><b>Ombudsperson</b>: Kristen Robillard</p>
<p>Learn more about the <a href="/campus-life/ombuds.html" adhocenable="false">Ombuds Office</a>.</p>
<hr>

<h3>Records Management and University Archives</h3>
<p>Ensures the proper organization, preservation and disposal of university documents and records.</p>
<p><b>Director, Records Management and University Archives</b>: Marie-Pierre AubÃ©</p>
<p>Learn more about <a href="http://archives.concordia.ca" adhocenable="false">Records Management and University Archives</a>.</p>
<hr>

<h3>Translation Services</h3>
<p>Provides University faculty and staff French translation and related services.</p>
<p><b>Director, Translation Services</b>:&nbsp; Eric Laberge</p>
<p>Learn more about <a href="http://web2.concordia.ca/translation/" adhocenable="false">Translation Services</a>.</p>
<hr>

<h3>Office of Community Engagement<br>
</h3>
<p>Supports, connects and promotes new and existing community-university partnerships at Concordia.</p>
<p><b>Community Relations Coordinator:&nbsp;</b> Eryn Fitzgerald<br>
</p>
<p>Learn more about the <a href="/about/community.html" adhocenable="false">Office of Community Engagement</a>.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

        <div class="span8">
            <div class="post highlighted">            
                <h1 class="article-title">Policy on Harassment: Frequently Asked Questions</h1>
                
                <div class="clearfix"></div>
                <div class="infos">
	                <div class="date">Posted on October 20, 2011</div>
	                <div class="separator">|</div>
	                <div class="author">
	                   <div class="author parbase picker">





</div>

	                </div>
	                <div class="source">
	                   <div class="single source">





</div>
                
                    </div>
                </div>
                
                <div class="rte">
                    <div class="parbase details wysiwyg">



<div class="rte">
<p><b>Concordia&rsquo;s Policy on Harassment, Sexual Harassment and Psychological Harassment (HR-38)</b></p> <p><b>Frequently Asked Questions</b></p> <p><i><b>What constitutes harassment and what does it look like?</b></i><br /> Harassment is all forms of repeated or ongoing unwelcome, vexatious conduct, including but not limited to, sexual harassment, psychological harassment or harassment based on a ground prohibited by law (please consult article 28 of the Code of Rights and Responsibilities). <br /> &nbsp;<br /> A single, serious incidence of such behavior may constitute harassment if it has the same consequences and if it produces a lasting harmful effect on the member.<br /> <br /> Harassment has the effect or purpose of unreasonably interfering with a member's right to pursue his/her work, study or other activities related to university life in a safe and civil manner or of creating an intimidating or hostile environment for such activities.</p> <p><i><b>What should I do if I think I am being harassed?</b></i><br /> It is important to take action promptly so that the undesired conduct stops and does not happen again. Such steps could include speaking to the person directly who is harassing you, identifying the behavior and asking them to immediately stop and correct it.<br /> <br /> Other actions could include discussing the situation with a manager or supervisor. You may also wish to discuss the situation and seek advice from designated individuals within the university who specifically deal with concerns of harassment. <br /> <i><b><br /> Where can I go if I think I am being harassed?</b></i><br /> You may go to the Department of Human Resources, specifically the Employment and Organizational Effectiveness unit or Employee and Labour Relations unit, or a union representative if applicable. At any time you may also seek assistance or advice from the advisor on rights and responsibilities (referred to as the advisor in the remainder of this document). The advisor can provide information, give advice and support, explain options for resolving an issue, and help decide on a course of action. Due process and confidentiality will be observed.&nbsp;&nbsp; <br /> <i><b><br /> Why was this policy created?</b></i><br /> The university is committed to safeguarding a healthy environment for its members and is committed to the values of civility, equity, respect, non-discrimination and an appreciation of diversity. Concordia&rsquo;s Policy on Harassment, Sexual Harassment and Psychological Harassment (HR-38) guides the university's practice and helps ensure our compliance with laws, regulations and government requirements concerning harassment. <br /> <br /> It is imperative that situations of harassment be dealt with and remedied as soon as possible and that recurrences are prevented. The policy incorporates prevention and education as well as support and redress when harassment violations occur.<br /> <i><b><br /> To whom does this policy apply? </b></i><br /> This policy (HR-38) applies to all staff, faculty members, and members of the administration of the university. The policy does not replace or supersede any applicable provisions set out in any collective or employee agreement.<br /> <i><b><br /> What if I am a student?&nbsp; </b></i><br /> Any member of the university (student, staff or faculty member) who has a concern regarding the behaviour of a staff or faculty member that may constitute a form of harassment is strongly encouraged to consult the advisor. <br /> <br /> The advisor can assist with informal dispute resolution procedures or with a formal resolution process, as described in the Code of Rights and Responsibilities.<br /> <i><b><br /> What if I am being harassed by a student?</b></i><br /> The Code of Rights and Responsibilities outlines both informal and formal processes that are available to deal with complaints against students. People are strongly encouraged to consult the advisor.<br /> <b><br /> </b><i><b>When should I seek assistance or make a complaint?</b></i><br /> It is recommended that attempts to resolve any allegations of harassment take place as soon as possible. The sooner you seek advice or assistance, the simpler it may be to resolve a conflict. If it is necessary to file a formal complaint, the advisor can inform the complainant of any time delays as specified in the code or in the respondent&rsquo;s collective agreement. <br /> <br /> In matters of psychological harassment, complaints should be filed within 90 days of the last incident.<br /> <br /> What are the different resolution options and how do I know which one is best for me to pursue?<br /> The advisor can help you evaluate your options and make an informed choice of what steps to take. Responses may range from the use of informal dispute resolution methods to formal procedures for adjudicating complaints. In most cases informal resolution is both possible and desirable. If the situation warrants, the advisor can guide you on how to proceed with a formal complaint.<br /> <br /> <i><b>What if I do not want to file a formal complaint but I want some help or assistance?</b></i><br /> Your supervisor, the Department of Human Resources, or the advisor on rights and responsibilities may be able to assist. Consultations with the advisor are confidential. You do not have to file a complaint in order to get information or advice. Sometimes trying different steps may restore harmony, collegiality and cooperation between members and could preempt the need for a formal complaint.<br /> <i><br /> <b>If I decide to make a formal complaint, what happens then? </b></i><br /> The allegation(s) of harassment will be investigated. The investigator will take the necessary steps to resolve the matter in such a manner as to respect the principles of natural justice and the procedures of any collective or employee agreement or university policy, which may apply.<br /> <br /> Upon the completion of the investigation, if the complaint is founded, disciplinary measuresmay be imposed or a remedial action taken, as permitted by the relevant collective or employee agreement or university policy.<br /> <i><b><br /> How can I learn more about the policy?</b></i><br /> The university will issue periodic communications to all students, staff, and faculty as a means to prevent harassment. Training will be available to managers and supervisors. Please consult the learning and development calendar for the next available session at:&nbsp; <br /> http://www.concordia.ca/hr/training-development/calendar/ <br /> <br /> You may also contact the Office of Rights and Responsibilities and/or the Department of Human Resources.<br /> <br /> <b>Office of Rights and Responsibilities</b><br /> In person:&nbsp; Room GM-1120, Guy-Metro Building (1550 De Maisonneuve Blvd. W.)<br /> Telephone: 514-848-2424, ext. 8659<br /> Email: <a href="mailto:rights@concordia.ca">rights@concordia.ca</a><br /> <br /> <b>Department of Human Resources</b><br /> <b>Department of Human Resources</b><br /> In person: Room FB 1130 (11th Floor), Faubourg Tower, 1250 Guy Street <br /> Email:&nbsp; <a href="mailto:www.concordia.ca/hr/contact/">www.concordia.ca/hr/contact/</a></p> <p><b>Related link:</b><br />&bull;&nbsp; &quot;Dealing with harassment&quot; - NOW, October 20, 2011</p> 
</div></div>

                </div>
                <div class="parsys">




</div>

                <hr>
                <div class="related-links parbase picker">






</div>

            </div>
        </div>

            <div class="parsys story-parsys">

</div>

</div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

        <div class="span8">
            <div class="post highlighted">            
                <h1 class="article-title">Dealing with harassment</h1>
                
                <div class="subtitle">Concordia's harassment policy sheds light on problem behaviour</div>
                
                <div class="clearfix"></div>
                <div class="infos">
	                <div class="date">Posted on October 19, 2011</div>
	                <div class="separator">|</div>
	                <div class="author">
	                   <div class="author parbase picker">






	<span>By: Tom Peacock</span>
</div>

	                </div>
	                <div class="source">
	                   <div class="single source">





</div>
                
                    </div>
                </div>
                
                <div class="rte">
                    <div class="parbase details wysiwyg">



<div class="rte">
<p>Concordia&rsquo;s policy on harassment, sexual harassment and psychological harassment exists to help ensure Concordia&rsquo;s students, staff and faculty members are protected from such behaviour, and understand the procedures for dealing with harassment if and when it does occur.<br /> <br /> Harassment, as defined by Concordia&rsquo;s Code of Rights and Responsibilities, constitutes unwelcome, vexatious conduct that could come in the form of sexual harassment, psychological harassment or harassment that breaks laws governing someone&rsquo;s rights to work in a safe and supportive environment.</p> <div style="float:right; display:inline; margin:0 0 1em 15px; width:250px;" class="img_wrapper"><div class="inner_shadow"><img width="250" height="279" alt="" src="dealing-with-harassment/_jcr_content/images/image_jpg_0.img.jpg"/></div></div> <p>&ldquo;Psychological harassment really can affect a member&rsquo;s dignity,&rdquo; explains Concordia&rsquo;s Rights and Responsibilities Advisor Louise Shiller. &ldquo;It affects their psychological or physical integrity.&nbsp; All forms of harassment can interfere with a person&rsquo;s right to pursue their work or study. Basically, it creates an intimidating or hostile environment.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> Concordia&rsquo;s harassment policy states that prevention is the best tool for eliminating such behaviour. The policy encourages all members of the university community to familiarize themselves with the definitions of harassment, and to &ldquo;take all necessary steps to prevent that conduct from occurring.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> According to Shiller, the appropriate response to harassment once it occurs is to get it out in the open. The policy encourages individuals to tell the person responsible to stop the offending behaviour. If this is impossible or ineffective, then the behaviour should be reported to a supervisor or manager, or the Offfice of Rights and Responsibilities.<br /> <br /> &ldquo;I&rsquo;ll give my opinion on what I think the situation looks like, and inform the person of their options,&rdquo; Shiller says. &ldquo;Obviously we like to try and resolve things informally if we can.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> Often it&rsquo;s enough to bring someone&rsquo;s actions to their attention, for the harassment to stop. &ldquo;A lot of times people aren&rsquo;t aware they&rsquo;re creating a hostile environment,&rdquo; Shiller says. &ldquo;Sometimes we have supervisors or managers who are new to the position, and may need some tips on how to properly manage other people.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> In some situations legitimate use of management authority may be unpleasant, but it may not constitute harassment.<br /> <br /> Sometimes, however, more decisive action has to be taken, such as mediation between two parties, or a formal complaint, followed by an investigation. If an investigation proves a charge of harassment to be founded, then sanctions may be taken against the individual responsible.<br /> <br /> &ldquo;The same principles apply with any infraction under the Code of Rights and Responsibilities,&rdquo; Shiller says. &ldquo;These are the principles of fairness and natural justice. If we do proceed to a formal process, we have to ensure all sides are heard equally.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> It&rsquo;s important to also remember that harassment is not always a case of someone in a position of power abusing that power. &ldquo;It could be between two colleagues, it could be between two supervisors,&rdquo; Shiller says. &ldquo;I&rsquo;ve had students come to me and tell me they&rsquo;ve felt harassed. It could pretty much be any combination.&rdquo;<br /> <br /> Concordia&rsquo;s harassment policy, together with the Code of Rights and Responsibilities, is an effort to ensure actions that amount to harassment are not swept under the rug. The definitions of harassment are clear, the methods for dealing with it are laid out, and it is the responsibility of every individual to report harassment so it can be dealt with as soon as possible.<br /> <br /> &ldquo;The code is not punitive in nature, and neither is this policy,&rdquo; Shiller insists. &ldquo;They exist to promote respect and to promote a healthy working environment. Ultimately, that&rsquo;s what you&rsquo;re looking for.&rdquo;<br /> <b><br /> Related links:</b><br /> &bull;&nbsp;&nbsp;Harassment policy<br /> &bull;&nbsp; &ldquo;Code Sets Standards of Conduct&rdquo; &ndash; NOW, October 5, 2011<br /> &bull;&nbsp; FAQ</p> 
</div></div>

                </div>
                <div class="parsys">




</div>

                <hr>
                <div class="related-links parbase picker">






</div>

            </div>
        </div>

            <div class="parsys story-parsys">

	        </a>

            <div class="experts parbase find-an-expert box">






<div class="c-sidebar-findexpert bloc box-component-no-border" style="background-color: #ffffff">
    <h4 class="section-header">FIND AN EXPERT</h4>
    <p>Search for an expert to comment on any topic.<br><span class="muted">Enter a phrase or keyword</span></p>
    
    <form action="/news/media-relations/find-an-expert.html" method="GET">
        <fieldset>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Bram Freedman</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parsys_column row-fluid cq-colctrl-lt0"><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt0-c0 span6"><div class="parbase image section"><div id="cq-image-jsp-/content/concordia/en/about/administration-governance/office-vp-development-external-relations-secretary-general/bram-freedman/jcr:content/content-main/image"><img title="Bram_Freedman" alt="Bram_Freedman" class="cq-dd-image" src="/about/administration-governance/office-vp-development-external-relations-secretary-general/bram-freedman/_jcr_content/content-main/image.img.jpg/1376335597831.jpg"></div>
    
    
<script type="text/javascript">
    (function() {
        var imageDiv = document.getElementById("cq-image-jsp-/content/concordia/en/about/administration-governance/office-vp-development-external-relations-secretary-general/bram-freedman/jcr:content/content-main/image");
        var imageEvars = '{ imageLink: "/", imageAsset: "/content/dam/concordia/images/about/Bram_Freedman.jpg", imageTitle: "Bram_Freedman" }';
        var tagNodes = imageDiv.getElementsByTagName('A');
        for (var i = 0; i < tagNodes.length; i++) {
            var link = tagNodes.item(i); 
            link.setAttribute('onclick', 'CQ_Analytics.record({event: "imageClick", values: ' + imageEvars + ', collect:  false, options: { obj: this }, componentPath: "foundation/components/image"})');
        }
        
    })();
</script>
</div>
</div><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt0-c1 span6"><div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Bram Freedman was appointed Vice-President, External Relations and Secretary-General at Concordia University in February 2008. As of July 2013, his portfolio was expanded to include oversight for the Advancement and Alumni Relations sector and he now serves as Vice-President, Development and External Relations, and Secretary-General.</p>
<p>Reporting to the President, he manages the planning and execution of all fundraising activities and campaigns and alumni stewardship, as well as the cultivation of donors, and events planning. Freedman serves as president of the Concordia University Foundation, which manages funds donated to the university.</p>

</div></div>
</div></div><div style="clear:both"></div><div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>In addition, he oversees government and external relations, university governance, and legal affairs. Freedmanâ€™s other responsibilities include oversight of institutional records management and archives, translation services, the Office of Rights and Responsibilities and acting as the link between the Board and Ombudsperson.</p>
<p>Before his return to Concordia in February 2008, Freedman was Chief Operating Officer and director of External Relations at Federation CJA, the central fundraising and community service organization for Quebecâ€™s Jewish community. He is an active volunteer who has held several senior positions in organizations that include CLSC MÃ©tro, Jewish Family Services, Jewish Eldercare Centre and the Reconstructionist Synagogue of Montreal as well as Destination Centre-Ville. He is also a member the Conseil emploi mÃ©tropole, an advisory committee named by the Quebec Ministry of Labour.</p>
<p>Freedman holds law degrees from McGill University.</p>
<p><a adhocenable="false" href="/about/administration-governance/office-vp-development-external-relations-secretary-general.html">Read more about the Office</a> and services it offers.</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation_0">

<ul style='display:block;'><li class=''><a class='' href='/about/administration-governance/president.html'>Office of the President & Vice-Chancellor</a><div class='arrow '><i></i></div><ul style='display:none;'><li class=''><a class='' href='/about/administration-governance/president/alan-shepard.html'>President's biography</a></li><li class=''><div class='arrow '><i></i></div><ul style='display:none;'><li class=''><a class='' href='/about/administration-governance/president/events/remarks-to-the-boardoftradeofmetropolitanmontreal.html'>Remarks to the Board of Trade of Metropolitan Montreal</a></li></ul></li></ul></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/about/administration-governance/office-provost-vp-academic-affairs.html'>Office of the Provost & VP, Academic Affairs</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/about/administration-governance/office-vp-research-graduate-studies.html'>Office of the VP, Research & Graduate Studies</a></li><li class='open'><a class='' href='/about/administration-governance/office-vp-development-external-relations-secretary-general.html'>Office of the VP, Development & External Relations, & Secretary General</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/about/administration-governance/office-vp-services.html'>Office of the VP, Services</a></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/about/administration-governance/office-chief-financial-officer.html'>Office of the Chief Financial Officer</a><div class='arrow '><i></i></div><ul style='display:none;'><li class=''><a class='' href='/about/administration-governance/office-chief-financial-officer/budget-2013-2014.html'>Budget 2013-2014</a></li></ul></li><li class=''><a class='' href='/about/administration-governance/office-chief-communications-officer.html'>Office of the Chief Communications Officer</a></li></ul>
</div>

jQuery(function() {
    $ = jQuery;
    $("#secondary_navigation_0.c-secondary-navigation .arrow").click(function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();

        $this.toggleClass('open');
        $this.parent().children('ul').slideToggle('fast');
    });
});
</script></div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<section id="content-main">

    <div class="container">
    
        <div class="row ">

            <div class="share-this">












	<script type="text/javascript">var switchTo5x=true;</script>
	<script type="text/javascript" src="http://w.sharethis.com/button/buttons.js"></script>
	<script type="text/javascript">
        stLight.options({
            publisher: "864f3db6-11cb-4e7b-9c5f-0a8a836ac323",
            onhover: false,

            // disable CopyNShare:
            doNotHash: true,
            doNotCopy: true,
            hashAddressBar: false,
        });
	</script>


</div>


            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<H1>Office of the President &amp; Vice-Chancellor</H1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase image section">




<div class="" id="cq-image-jsp-/content/concordia/en/about/administration-governance/president/jcr:content/content-main/image"><img title="20130410-Meet-n-Greet-President-Alan-Shepard-1018-500x333" alt="20130410-Meet-n-Greet-President-Alan-Shepard-1018-500x333" class="cq-dd-image" src="/content/concordia/en/about/administration-governance/president/_jcr_content/content-main/image.img.jpg/1379430787437.jpg"></div>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Through its founding institutions, Concordia University has a distinguished history of more than 100 years of providing higher education that is respected across Canada and recognized internationally. Concordia is known for its diversity, accessibility and connections to the community, and for robust academic programs in disciplines such as engineering, business, the humanities and fine and performing arts.</p>
<p>We approach societal issues from a broad perspective in preparing our students to become engaged citizens and in giving them the knowledge and skills needed to meet their education goals in a rapidly changing world. Our mission, vision and values are embodied in everything we do, from the development of our academic programs and institutional initiatives to the prudent management of our fiscal resources and sustainable development of our infrastructure. A key priority is to maintain a dialogue with our community, which includes some 46,000 students, 7,100 faculty and staff and 170,000 alumni from across Canada and around the world.</p>
<p>I invite you to find out more about Concordia through the public documents accessible through this page and elsewhere on our website. Students, parents and other members of the public will find information about the universityâ€™s strategic framework and academic plan and its role as an institution of higher learning that is fully integrated into the economic, social and cultural fabric of one of the worldâ€™s most dynamic cities.</p>
<p>Alan Shepard</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase external section"><iframe src="
//www.youtube.com/embed/sQkz6IxciUE
" width="
560
" height="
315
"></iframe>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p style="font-family: tahoma, arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px;">Alan Shepard speaking to the Board of Trade of Metropolitan Montreal, November 8, 2013.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parsys_column row-fluid cq-colctrl-lt0"><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt0-c0 span6"><div class="parbase button section">








<a style="margin-bottom:10px;" class="btn btn-large btn-block bg-light-grey" href="/about/administration-governance/president/alan-shepard.html" target="_self">Learn more about the President</a>

</div>
</div><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt0-c1 span6"><div class="parbase button section">








<a style="margin-bottom:10px;" class="btn btn-large btn-block bg-light-grey" href="#photo-galleries" target="_self">View photo galleries</a>

</div>
</div></div><div style="clear:both"></div><div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="accordion-panel section">





<div class="c-accordion toggable">
    <div class="item ">
        
        <div class="group panel">
            <h3 class="title">
                <a name="legend-expand" title="Open Office of the President and Vice-Chancellor directory">
					
                    Office of the President and Vice-Chancellor directory
                </a>
            </h3> 
            <div class="arrow"></div>
        </div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<H1>Alan Shepard, President and Vice-Chancellor</H1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Alan Shepard is president and vice-chancellor of Concordia University and professor of English in Concordiaâ€™s Faculty of Arts and Science. His term as Concordiaâ€™s ninth president began on August 1, 2012.</p>
<p>An emerging voice among university leaders, Shepard is rethinking how universities adapt to the changing needs of society, while continuing to foster innovation and entrepreneurship in support of research and higher education. His extensive experience in university administration in the United States and Canada has contributed to his reputation for thoughtful decisive leadership.</p>
<p><img style="float: right;" src="/content/dam/concordia/images/alan-shepard2.jpg"></p>
<p>Adaptation and change are also at the heart of his scholarship. As a specialist in Europeâ€™s early modern period, Shepard targets the nature of change reflected in theatre, fiction, and social movements. He has also written extensively on topics such as contemporary theatre, theatre and national security, writing and logical argument, and the rapidly changing academic and administrative environment for todayâ€™s universities.</p>
<p>Former editor-in-chief of the bilingual, multidisciplinary Canadian journal <i>Renaissance and Reformation</i>/<i>Renaissance et RÃ©forme</i>, he has presented and lectured internationally on a variety of scholarly topics and on public policy issues such as innovation, entrepreneurship and transformational change in higher education.</p>
<p>Among his essays and books, <i>Coming to Class</i> (1998), edited with two colleagues in Texas, was nominated by the readers of <i>Lingua Franca</i> as one of the best academic books in the 1990s. His educational experience includes international study at the University of Cambridge, and grants awarded for research and publication projects undertaken at universities in the United States and Canada. He has held fellowships at the Folger Library in Washington D.C., and two leading research centres at the University of Toronto.</p>
<p>Shepard is passionate about refining public policy on higher education and other social issues. He has held recent advisory roles with Ontario Universities International, Public Health Ontario, and the Council of Ontario Universities.</p>
<p>Shepard previously served as Ryerson Universityâ€™s provost and vice-president academic, where he had oversight of academic affairs, strategic planning and the budget. He led a series of transformational initiatives, including the development of Ryersonâ€™s academic plan, leading to the creation of a Faculty of Science. Shepard and his team established Ryersonâ€™s Digital Media Zone, bringing student-driven projects to market, and the Centre for Urban Energy, a centre for research collaboration with the public and private sectors.</p>
<p>Throughout his career, Shepard has been dedicated to improving the student experience, creating links to local institutions, and supporting innovative and entrepreneurial projects. As associate vice-president academic at the University of Guelph, he led a university-wide curriculum initiative, strengthened retention measures for first-year undergraduates and promoted the internationalism of academic programs. In the United States, Shepard taught and held administrative roles at the University of Virginia and TCU.</p>
<p>He has contributed as a volunteer in community organizations throughout his career. As an undergraduate student, he worked in hospital emergency services in Minnesota. In Virginia, he was a leader in the LGBT community, and in Texas he served on the board of the Walt Whitman School and was involved in a range of public service initiatives.</p>
<p>Shepard earned an undergraduate degree from St. Olaf College in Minnesota, where he won the George Weida Spohn Prize, and a PhD from the University of Virginia. He grew up in Iowa, California, and Minnesota, immigrated to Canada in 2002 and is a Canadian citizen. He lives in Montreal with his partner and their two sons. Shepardâ€™s favourite pastimes include travel, theatre, cycling and hiking. Shepard is a board member of the Board of Trade of Metropolitan Montreal for 2012-13.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

                    <a href="#" title="Twitter" class="st_twitter_custom">
                    	<span class="sprites-icon-social-2" displayText="Twitter" st_image='http://www.concordia.ca/content/concordia/en/about/administration-governance/president/events/remarks-to-the-boardoftradeofmetropolitanmontreal.img.png/1383945940803.jpg'>Twitter</span>
                    </a>
                </li>
                <li>

                    </a>
                </li>
            </ul>   
        </div>

                });
    
            });
        </script></div>


            <div class="span8">
                <div class="title title-main">





<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Remarks to the Board of Trade of Metropolitan Montreal</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>Concordia University President Alan Shepard spoke to the Board of Trade of Metropolitan Montreal on&nbsp;Friday, November 8, 2013.</p>

</div></div>
<div class="parbase gallery section">





<div style="clear:both;display:block;">

<script type="text/javascript">
    var $dropdowns = $('.nav li.dropdown');
    $dropdowns
        .on('mouseover', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverTimeout')) {
                $this.prop('hoverTimeout', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverTimeout')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverIntent', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.addClass('open');
            }, 0));
        })
        .on('mouseleave', function() {
            var $this = $(this);
            $this.siblings('.open').removeClass('open');

            if ($this.prop('hoverIntent')) {
                $this.prop('hoverIntent', clearTimeout($this.prop('hoverIntent')));
            }

            $this.prop('hoverTimeout', setTimeout(function() {
                $this.removeClass('open');
            }, 300));
        });
</script>

<div class="section-header-wrapper">
<h1>Office of the Provost &amp; VP, Academic Affairs</h1>
</div></div>

                <div class="parsys content-main">


<div class="parbase target section">








<div class="mboxDefault" id="content-concordia-en-about-administration-governance-office-provost-vp-academic-affairs-content-main-colctrl">
    
</div>


<script type="text/javascript">
	var mboxId = 'content-concordia-en-about-administration-governance-office-provost-vp-academic-affairs-content-main-colctrl';
	var mboxName = 'content-concordia-en-about-administration-governance-office-provost-vp-academic-affairs-content-main-colctrl';
	var mboxLocation = '/content/concordia/en/about/administration-governance/office-provost-vp-academic-affairs/jcr:content/content-main/colctrl';
	var wcmMode = 'DISABLED';

	if ( typeof mboxDefine == 'function' && wcmMode !== 'ANALYTICS' ) {
		var callParameters = [ mboxId ];
		var callFunction;
		var replaced = false;
	
		
				callFunction = mboxCreate;
		
		
		
		var staticParameters = {};
		
		for ( var key in staticParameters )
			callParameters.push(key  + '=' + staticParameters[key]);
		
		if ( !replaced ) { // do not define the same mbox twice, this leads to additional JS calls
			callFunction.apply(undefined, callParameters);
		}
		
		
		
		if ( callFunction == mboxDefine ) {
		    
		    // if the campaign store is available at this time we are most likely simulating
		    // so trigger an update if the (auto) campaign is selected
            var campaignStore = ClientContext.get("campaign");
            if ( campaignStore && !campaignStore.isCampaignSelected() ) {
                CQ_Analytics.TestTarget.triggerUpdate();
            }
    		
    		// wait for 2 seconds for the T&T answer to come in to prevent page flicker issues
    		// also see the overlay of mbox.protoype.setOffer which completes this
    		setTimeout(function() {
    		    CQ_Analytics.TestTarget.showDefaultMboxContent(mboxId, mboxName);
    		}, 2000);
		}
	}
	
	
		
</script>
</div>
<div class="text parbase section"><p>The Office of the Provost and VP, Academic Affairs manages all academic matters, including curriculum appraisals, contract negotiations for faculty members, and academic facilities, such as research centres and laboratories. The Provostâ€™s team also oversees enrolment and student services, and promotes academic leadership and supports faculty to help students succeed.</p>
</div>
<div class="parsys_column row-fluid cq-colctrl-lt0"><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt0-c0 span6"><div class="parbase button section">








<a style="margin-bottom:10px;" class="btn btn-large btn-block bg-light-grey" href="http://provost.concordia.ca/" target="_self">Learn more about the Office of the Provost</a>

</div>
</div><div class="parsys_column cq-colctrl-lt0-c1 span6"><div class="parbase button section">








<a style="margin-bottom:10px;" class="btn btn-large btn-block bg-light-grey" href="/about/strategic-framework/academic-plan.html" target="_self">Read the university's academic plan</a>

</div>
</div></div><div style="clear:both"></div><div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="title section">

<p><b>Deputy Provost:</b> Lisa Ostiguy</p>
<p><b>Executive Assistant to the Provost:</b> Claudia Deme</p>

</div></div>

</div>
<div class="section separator">




    <hr>
</div>
<div class="parbase wysiwyg section">



<div class="rte">
<p>The Office of the Provost is comprised of the following administrative units.</p>
<h3>Academic Operations</h3>
<p>Serves the universityâ€™s faculty members and promotes a healthy work environment through labour relations, training, support and conflict resolution. Also manages budgets for faculty salaries and workloads.</p>
<p>Read more about <a href="http://provost.concordia.ca/academic-operations/" adhocenable="false">Academic Operations</a></p>
<h3>Student and Enrolment Services</h3>
<p>Oversees and coordinates the services students need and expect â€“ from when they apply to when they prepare to graduate. Helps students with government documents and financial aid resources, offers health care and counseling services, and manages recreation, athletics and on-campus residences, among others.</p>
<h3>Teaching and Learning</h3>
<p>Assists faculty members with curriculum development and program appraisals, and offers teaching resources in an effort to create a learning environment that drives students to excel at university and in society.</p>
<p>Read more about <a href="http://provost.concordia.ca/teaching-and-learning/" adhocenable="false">Teaching and Learning</a></p>

</div></div>


</div>

            </div>
            
            <div class="span4">
                <div class="parsys sidebar">


<div class="parbase secondary-navigation section">







<div class="c-sidebar-menu c-secondary-navigation" id="secondary_navigation">

jQuery(function() {
    $ = jQuery;
    $("#secondary_navigation.c-secondary-navigation .arrow").click(function(e) {
        e.preventDefault();
        var $this = $(this);
        $this.toggleClass('open');
        $this.parent().children('ul').slideToggle('fast');
    });
});
</script></div>
